description: Sven Halek formally proposes at Council to use official communication channels to amplify teacher-led public forums and legitimize their assemblies, suggesting this is the only way to stabilize the city and bridge public mistrust.
Council quietly approves Sven’s strategy. Media resources are redirected from usual Council messaging to broadcast teacher-organized forums and promote open civic discussion throughout Stenograd.
Encouraged by the Council’s implicit endorsement, teacher-led forums spread citywide. Citizens share onboarding stories, debate system manipulation, and discuss Stenograd’s future in open assemblies.
Teachers and community volunteers organize open-air assemblies across districts. Children, parents, and elders share personal histories of compliance and resistance, fostering empathy and solidarity.
A citywide assembly is convened in central squares, led by educators. Citizens present a manifesto calling for transparent, participatory governance, directly challenging Council and BCI authority.
